intro: Malapoenna undulata, commonly known as the undulating malapoenna, is a flowering plant native to the grasslands of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring. Its structure and appearance make it well adapted to its arid and semi-arid habitats. Malapoenna undulata is often found in open areas with well-drained soils, where it thrives in full sun.
